metadata.title: CVE-2019-7304 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
Canonical snapd before version 2.37.1 incorrectly performed socket ownervalidation, allowing an attacker to run arbitrary commands as root. Thisissue affects: Canonical snapd versions prior to 2.37.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7304` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

snap-confine - 2.34.2+18.04.1
snapd - 2.34.2+18.04.1
snapd-xdg-open - 2.34.2+18.04.1
ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.34.2+18.04.1
ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.34.2+18.04.1
ubuntu-snappy - 2.34.2+18.04.1
ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.34.2+18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: snapd package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.34.2+18.04.1').
